report_title: Diesel Engine and Parts Wholesaling in the US
executive_summary: Business sentiment is expected to translate into greater levels of nonresidential construction. As construction levels rise, construction machinery manufacturers (33312) will experience an uptick in demand for their products, which will, in turn, lead to higher levels of demand for diesel engines and parts. Additionally, demand for mining, oil and gas machinery manufacturers (33313) is expected to recover over the next five years, as the price of crude oil is forecast to experience less price volatility. Although the price of crude oil is declining, oil machinery manufacturers increase their production as demand from their downstream markets grows.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry operators are expected to benefit from a stabilization in the price of steel. Steel is the key input used in producing diesel engines and parts. Therefore, when steel prices are low, diesel engine manufacturers pass on some of their cost savings to wholesalers, who can then price their products more competitively and gain a higher profit margin.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Diesel engines experience a high level of regulation from various government agencies, such as the Environmental Protection Agency and the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. This trend is expected to continue over the next five years to 2027, as environmental awareness is expected to continue growing.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry purchase diesel engines and parts, including crankshafts, fuel-injection systems, pistons and valves, among others, from manufacturers to sell to a plethora of downstream industries.

mixed_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: medium - steady

key_trends: The pandemic has greatly affected the industry
The price of steel has fluctuated significantly
An increase in the industrial production index represents stronger demand from other key downstream markets
Demand for mining, oil and gas machinery manufacturers is expected to recover over the next five years
Operators are still forecast to exit the industry, albeit at a far slower rate
Many manufactures are currently developing more environmentally friendly engines
Diesel engine and parts manufacturers contended with volatile input prices

market_segmentation.segment_description: Transportation and shipping industries account for the largest share of revenue in 2022, they account for 67.3% of industry revenue. Heavy-duty and medium-duty trucks are primarily used for shipping and freight purposes. Additionally, diesel engines are used for some freight ships and trains, further increasing this segment's share of revenue.
The mining sector is a big market for this industry. As a capital-intensive sector, the mining sector uses heavy machinery that requires large amounts of energy.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Crankshafts, Camshafts, Pistons Rings, Valves and Carburetor

tier_1_suppliers: Auto Parts Manufacturing in the US
Automobile Engine & Parts Manufacturing in the US
Engine & Turbine Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Iron Ore Mining in the US
Copper, Nickel, Lead & Zinc Mining in the US
Molybdenum & Metal Ore Mining in the US
tier_2_buyers: Auto Parts Wholesaling in the US
Used Car Parts Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for new diesel engines increases as the economy improves and businesses have increased funds for new vehicles. However, when the economy slows and businesses seek to cut costs, demand for replacement engine parts increases because downstream operators will be more likely to replace broken engine parts rather than purchase new engines or vehicles.

One factor working against the industry is public concern about pollution. Diesel engines produce more carbon emissions than gasoline and renewable energy engines, making them a significant source of pollution.

international_trade_points.trade_description: International trade does not occur at the wholesale level.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Industry operators typically need a license to operate as wholesalers, with requirements varying between states.
The EPA has requirements about diesel fuel emissions and fuel makeups.
The industry was not classified as essential during the pandemic, causing temporary shutdowns.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Wholesalers need to establish contracts with suppliers and buyers to operate successfully.
The industry is in a mature life cycle stage and has an established place in the economy.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies compete based on price, product specialty and location.
Wholesalers compete with diesel engine manufacturers and alternative energy sources.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Most companies operate at a regional or local level.
Some larger companies specialize in one type of product.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry operators' profit is largely tied to the price of steel.
Volatility in demand affects industry revenue and costs.
Volatility in oil prices impacts demand and affects revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Diesel Engine and Parts Wholesaling industry is characterized by a low level of capital intensity.
Industry operators rely heavily on their workforce.
One of the largest capital investments is computer management systems.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue decreased 12.7% in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Volatility is tied to fluctuations in demand.
Volatility in oil prices impacts demand.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry has benefited from automated systems.
Investment in non-diesel engines poses a threat.

FAQs.question: How have your sales been affected by the growth of online shopping?
FAQs.answer: While e-commerce has siphoned some demand from industry operators, it is not a large factor in diesel engine and parts wholesaling.

FAQs.question: Are your sales heavily dependent on any one market, major customer or other isolated revenue stream?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators serve a number of downstream markets; however, the health of the mining, oil and gas extraction manufacturing industry is particularly important to operators' success.

FAQs.question: How does the size of your company affect its profitability and growth potential?
FAQs.answer: Larger operators are generally able to secure better pricing arrangements.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored growth opportunities via mergers or acquisitions?
FAQs.answer: This industry is not highly concentrated, and operators are generally small in size.

FAQs.question: How has your company been able to implement technology into the purchasing process to make buying more efficient?
FAQs.answer: Computer management systems have become integral to operations.

FAQs.question: Does your company currently have an e-commerce platform for volume sales? If not, do you have plans to create one?
FAQs.answer: Most operators have some form of an online presence.

FAQs.question: How does your company monitor potential changes to the regulatory environment?
FAQs.answer: Operators can turn to associations for regulation advice.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all relevant health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Operators must stay updated on health and safety regulations.

FAQs.question: How do your profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Larger operators are able to maintain stable and higher profit margins.

FAQs.question: How has input price volatility affected your purchase costs and selling prices over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Operators had difficulty securing stable pricing from suppliers.

FAQs.question: Do you have stable contracts with major manufacturers in place? Can you expand into other manufacturing sectors?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers need contracts with major manufacturers.

FAQs.question: How do you go about establishing secure distribution agreements? How much control do you have over your prices?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers have better control of prices when they have control over distribution agreements.

FAQs.question: What technologies do you embrace to better manage your distribution methods? How do you assess the effectiveness of your distribution methods?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers are able to generate greater revenue when distribution is managed efficiently.

FAQs.question: How has growth in the average age of the fleet affected your company's revenue? How do you generate revenue when demand for replacement parts is low?
FAQs.answer: Heavy-duty vehicles eventually need repair or replacement after long periods of use.

FAQs.question: How do you ensure your products meet all regulations?
FAQs.answer: Changes in regulation can cause prices for wholesalers to increase.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulation violations in the past?
Do you specialize in certain types of machinery? How can you expand your product portfolio?
FAQs.answer: Demand for industry wholesalers climbs when manufacturers increase investments in this equipment.
